column4: open a terminal, run 'killall firefox && firefox -ProfileManager' , create a new, empty  profile for testing and try if firefox starts with that
firefox: no process killed
nothing else happened
then firefox wasn't running. just make a fresh profile with firefox --ProfileManager
i know it wasnt running... i said i restarted computer and reinstalled firefox and the error didnt change
reinstalling didn't give you a new clean profile
ok... i created a new profile... thanks
how do i recover last one
did you install some new addon or did anything specfial?
didnt install any addon or anything that i can remember
so if a new profile works the error is in your user profile... some bad addon, corrupted database... whatever... i can't guess what it might be
you might get useful information if you switch back tto your old profile and run 'firefox' from a terminal. YOu might get an error message
cant use last profile.. says its already being used
hmmm... there could be some stale lock file in that profile, and you get it back by just deleting it
deleting the profile? wont i lose everything?
not deleting the profile... only deleting a .lock or similar named file in the profile folder
where is the profile folder :P
i'm not too familiar with firefox' mechanism of determinig locks, so might better ask in #firefox . you profiles are kept in ~/.mozilla/firefox
ok thanks
BTW, teh fiel you're looking for is .parentlock just on the first level in the profile subfolder
i just copied everything inside the last profile folder to the new one :P
worked
